title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: first load artificially created data1. Let’s look input want model. isatpanel command takes:

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: specification source data, group time variable group-time characteristics. can entered function two ways: gets package style .e. using vectors matrices specify y, mxreg, time id also form resembles lm plm specification .e. inputting data.frame (matrix tibble), formula argument well character vectors index (form c("group_variable_name", "time_variable_name")) argument Fixed Effect Specification using effect. already means following two commands give result: Using new method Using traditional method onwards, use lm notation.
code: is_lm <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                    formula = gdp ~ temp,                     index = c("country","year"),                                        effect = "twoways",                                        fesis = TRUE) is_gets <- isatpanel(y = pandata_simulated$gdp,                      mxreg = pandata_simulated$temp,                      time = pandata_simulated$year,                      id = pandata_simulated$country,                       effect = "twoways",                       fesis = TRUE)

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: can plot simply using default plotting methods (rely ggplot2 package):
code: plot(is_lm) plot_grid(is_lm) #> Error in data.frame(name = names(coef(x$isatpanel.result)), coef = coef(x$isatpanel.result)): arguments imply differing number of rows: 0, 107 plot_counterfactual(is_lm) #> Error in UseMethod("vcov"): no applicable method for 'vcov' applied to an object of class "isat"

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: argument works just gets package. method simply adds 0 1 dummy observation. Simply set iis = TRUE.
code: iis_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                          formula = gdp ~ temp,                          index = c("country","year"),                           effect = "twoways",                           iis = TRUE) plot(iis_example)

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: Traditional Step Indicator Saturation make sense panel setting. Therefore, gets function sis disabled.

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: possible, however, consider Step Indicator Saturation common breaks across individuals. indicators collinear, effects = c("twoways") effects = c("time") .e. Time Fixed Effects included. , however, effect = "individual" can use jsis = TRUE select individual time fixed effects.
code: jsis_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                           formula = gdp ~ temp,                           index = c("country","year"),                            effect = "twoways",                            jsis = TRUE) plot(jsis_example) #> Error in `FUN()`: #> ! Aesthetic must be a one-sided formula, call, name, or constant.

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: Note: method tested using lm implementation (using data, formula, index). method allows detection coefficient breaks common across groups. interaction jsis relevant coefficient. illustrate , well advantages using lm approach, include non-linear term temperature variable using (temp^2):  default, coefficients interacted added indicator list - can controlled using csis_var, takes character vector column names .e. csis_var = "temp".
code: csis_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                           formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                           index = c("country","year"),                            effect = "twoways",                            csis = TRUE) plot(csis_example) csis_example2 <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                            formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                            index = c("country","year"),                             effect = "twoways",                             csis = TRUE,                            csis_var = "temp")

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: equivalent supplying constant mxbreak argument old method. essentially breaks group-specific intercept .e. individual fixed effect.  Similar csis_var idea, can specify fesis method subset individuals well using fesis_id variable, takes character vector individuals. case can use e.g. fesis_id = c("2","3").
code: fesis_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                            formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                            index = c("country","year"),                             effect = "twoways",                             fesis = TRUE) plot(fesis_example) fesis_example2 <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                            formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                            index = c("country","year"),                             effect = "twoways",                             fesis = TRUE,                            fesis_id = c("2","3")) plot(fesis_example2)

what: Coefficient Fixed Effect Step Indicator Saturation
title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: method combines csis fesis approach detects whether coefficients individual units break time. means can also combine subsetting variable individual units using cfesis_id cfesis_var.
code: cfesis_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                             formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                             index = c("country","year"),                              effect = "twoways",                              cfesis = TRUE,                             cfesis_id = c("2","3"),                             cfesis_var = "temp") plot(cfesis_example)

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: now possible specify argument include autoregressive coefficients, using ar argument.
code: fesis_ar1_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                                formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                                index = c("country","year"),                                 effect = "twoways",                                 fesis = TRUE,                                 ar = 1)

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: options robust.isatpanel use HAC Standard Errors, use standard White Standard Error Correction (option clustering S.E. within groups time):

title: getspanel: Getting Started
text: Another new argument also engine argument. allows us use external package estimate models. stage, fixest package can used. also means can now use argument cluster Standard Errors using cluster. can verify , using clustering Standard Errors , using fixest package change estimates: Compared default estimator: However, changing cluster specification course . Standard Error correction ’s current implementation valid, allows many indicators true - therefore clustering therefore recommended.
code: fixest_example <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                             formula = gdp ~ temp,                             index = c("country","year"),                              effect = "twoways",                              fesis = TRUE,                              engine = "fixest",                             cluster = "none") head(fixest_example$isatpanel.result$mean.results) head(is_lm$isatpanel.result$mean.results) fixest_example_cluster <- isatpanel(data = pandata_simulated,                                     formula = gdp ~ temp + I(temp^2),                                     index = c("country","year"),                                      effect = "twoways",                                      fesis = TRUE,                                      engine = "fixest",                                     cluster = "individual") plot(fixest_example_cluster)

code: @Manual{,   title = {getspanel: General-to-Specific Modelling of Panel Data},   author = {Felix Pretis and Moritz Schwarz},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/moritzpschwarz/getspanel, http://moritzschwarz.org/getspanel/}, }

title: General-to-Specific Modelling of Panel Data
text: package panel adaptation gets package see see . code developed Felix Pretis Moritz Schwarz. associated working paper published “Panel Break Detection: Detecting Unknown Treatment, Stability, Heterogeneity, Outliers” Pretis Schwarz, available SSRN .

title: General-to-Specific Modelling of Panel Data
text: can install released version getspanel CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("getspanel") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("moritzpschwarz/getspanel")

title: General-to-Specific Modelling of Panel Data

title: Panel isat function — isatpanel
text: Panel isat function

title: Panel isat function — isatpanel
code: isatpanel(   data = NULL,   formula = NULL,   index = NULL,   effect = c("individual"),   na.remove = TRUE,   engine = NULL,   user.estimator = NULL,   cluster = "none",   ar = 0,   iis = FALSE,   sis = FALSE,   jiis = FALSE,   jsis = FALSE,   fesis = FALSE,   csis = FALSE,   cfesis = FALSE,   csis_var = colnames(mxreg),   fesis_id = NULL,   cfesis_var = colnames(mxreg),   cfesis_id = NULL,   plot = FALSE,   plm_model = "within",   y = NULL,   id = NULL,   time = NULL,   mxreg = NULL,   ... )

title: Panel isat function — isatpanel
text: data input data.frame object. formula Please specify formula argument. dependent variable left-element, separated ~ symbol remaining regressors. Note intercept always removed, effect "none" - means fixed effects specified, intercept always removed. index Specify name group time column format c("id", "time"). effect Fixed Effect specification. Possible arguments: "twoways", "individual", "time", "none". na.remove remove NAs engine Estimation function use. Default NULL, uses default estimation procedure gets package. Alternatives "fixest", "plm", "felm". user.estimator Use user.estimator cluster cluster Standard Errors level. Default "none". Possible values : "indvidiual", "time", "twoways". ar Autoregressive Term included. default 0. iis use Impulse Indicator Saturation sis use Step Indicator Saturation. possible time fixed effects used, collinear otherwise. jiis use Joint Impulse Indicator Saturation (Outliers common across units). essentially just time fixed effect, allows selection FE. jsis use Join Step Indicator Saturation (steps common across units) fesis Fixed Effect Step Indicator Saturation. Constructed multiplying constant (1) group Fixed Effects. Default FALSE. csis Coefficient Step Indicator Saturation. Constructed Default FALSE. cfesis Coefficient-Fixed Effect Indicator Saturation. Default FALSE. csis_var csis method can conducted (default) variables just subset . want use subset, please specify column names variable character vector. fesis_id fesis method can conducted (default) individuals/units (.e. looking breaks individual countries) just subset (joint breaks coefficients individuals). want use subset, please specify individuals/units want test stability character vector. cfesis_var cfesis method can conducted variables (default) just subset . want use subset, please specify column names variable character vector. cfesis_id cfesis method can conducted individuals/units (default) just subset . want use subset, please specify individuals/units tested character vector. plot Logical. final object plotted? Default FALSE. plm_model Type PLM model (engine = "PLM") y Deprecated. dependent variable. Can used data, index, formula specified. id Deprecated. Can used data, index, formula specified. Must vector grouping variable character factor time Deprecated. Can used data, index, formula specified. Must vector time variable integer numeric. mxreg co-variates matrix ... arguments gets::isat()

title: Plotting an isatpanel object — plot.isatpanel
code: # S3 method for isatpanel plot(   x,   max.id.facet = 16,   facet.scales = "free",   title = NULL,   zero_line = FALSE,   ... )

title: Plotting an isatpanel object — plot.isatpanel
text: x object produced isatpanel function max.id.facet resulting plot faceted individual panel. Beyond certain number, might result unreadable figures. Default set 16. facet.scales passed ggplot2::facet_wrap. Default "free" (.e. separate y axis panel group/id). Alternatives : "fixed", "fixed_y", "fixed_x". title Plot title. Must character vector. zero_line Plot horizontal line y = 0. Default FALSE. ... arguments passed ggplot2.

title: Plotting an isatpanel object — plot.isatpanel
text: ggplot2 plot plots 'isatpanel' object shows observed data, fitted values, identified breaks impulses.

HAC Heteroscedasticity Autocorrelation Robust Standard Errors used? lag Number Lags used HAC coeftest. specified HAC = FALSE. effect effects introduced plm model, one "individual", "time", "twoways" (default), "nested" type Type Robust procedure e.g. HC0 White SE HC3 Lang cluster 'group' 'time' FALSE
